page.title: 15MY VILLAGE AND ITS CONCERNS.
page.content:
50 years ago St.Budeaux was a small village surrounded by fields and orchards.Today it's a busy,built up town.
The traffic flow has increased enormously due to the Royal Naval Dockyard,Devonport and the Tamar bridge.
Population consists mainly of Naval families, dockyard workers.
People interviewed in St.Budeaux felt it to be a good,friendly,caring community;having a good variety of shops adequate for daily needs.Good bus,a restricted train service to Plymouth and Cornwall.A library,banks, Bingo Hall,Post Office provide extra facilities. Cont.
